body_html: I think one of Peter's goals is to make the parity better. The register_parameter choice you bring up is because I think most people used assignment in Python, (self.linear = nn.Linear()), but you can't do this in C++. To minimize the amount of boilerplate, I went with a shorter function name.
body_text: I think one of Peter's goals is to make the parity better. The register_parameter choice you bring up is because I think most people used assignment in Python, (self.linear = nn.Linear()), but you can't do this in C++. To minimize the amount of boilerplate, I went with a shorter function name.
body: I think one of Peter's goals is to make the parity better. The register_parameter choice you bring up is because I think most people used assignment in Python, (self.linear = nn.Linear()), but you can't do this in C++. To minimize the amount of boilerplate, I went with a shorter function name.
